sailpoint.connector

Class ConnectorException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • sailpoint.tools.AbstractLocalizableException
          • sailpoint.connector.ConnectorException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.Localizable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AuthenticationFailedException, ConnectionFailedException, InsufficientPermissionException, InvalidConfigurationException, InvalidRequestException, InvalidResponseException, ObjectAlreadyExistsException, ObjectNotFoundException, SchemaNotDefinedException

    public class ConnectorException
extends sailpoint.tools.AbstractLocalizableException
    The base exception thrown by all connectors.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException()
        Construct a ExceptionWrapper with no message or nested throwable.

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.String message)
        Construct a new ConnectorException with a detailed message.
        Parameters:
        message - detail message

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.Throwable t)
        Construct a new ConnectorException wrapping an existing exception.

        The existing exception will be embedded in the new one, and its message will become the default message for the ConnectorException.

        Parameters:
        t - nested Throwable

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.Throwable t)
        Create a new ConnectorException from an existing exception.

        The existing exception will be embedded in the new one, but the new exception will have its own message.

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(Message message)
        Construct a new ConnectorException with a detailed message.
        Parameters:
        message - detailed message with type Message.

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(Message message,
                          java.lang.Throwable t)
        Create a new ConnectorException from an existing exception and object Message. By calling this constructor, the existing exception will be embedded with the message passed
        Parameters:
        message - detailed message with type Message.
        t - Throwable exception.

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.Throwable t,
                          java.lang.String errorCode)
        This constructor is used for passing error code
        Parameters:
        t -
        errorCode -

      • ConnectorException

        public ConnectorException(java.lang.String error,
                          java.lang.String suggestion,
                          java.lang.Throwable t)
        Create a new ConnectorException from an error text, suggestion text and existing exception.

        The error and suggestion being set here is used later to prepare well formatted exception message based on resource bundle key 'msg_with_suggestion' and 'msg_no_suggestion'.

        Parameters:
        error - ResourceBundle message key, or a plain text message containing error details.
        suggestion - ResourceBundle message key, or a plain text message containing hints to solve the error.
        t - Throwable object t can be provided at the time of calling following constructor.
